question: Why doesn’t my client show up in my book of business anymore?
text:
Why doesnt my client show up in my book of business anymore?
          
        
Virginia's Insurance Marketplace migrated data in September from Healthcare.gov. Virginia's Insurance Marketplace relied on the data provided by Healthcare.gov and producers during pre-registration to link customers with their agent. If you successfully completed the pre-registration contact form by September 7, your customers (with PY 2023 enrollments) who were migrated from the FFM should appear in your Virginia Insurance Marketplace Book of Business.
There are a few reasons a client may not appear in an agent Book of Business:
- You did not submit a fully accurate and complete contact form.
- A customer may not have been successfully linked to you as their agent.
- The customer could have de-designated you as their agent of record.
The good news is Virginia's Insurance Marketplace makes it easy for agents to find customers who were not attached to their Book of Business.
- Agents can search for a customer with the consumer's name and social security number and self-designate as the agent of record.
- Customers can also search for an agent in the platform and send a request to that agent to be added. These functions can be done at any time.
- Agents can request a customer to re-designate you as their agent. To learn more, see How does a customer find and designate a producer?
- You can always contact the Virginia Insurance Marketplace
for additional assistance in determining why the customer no longer designated or to get help adding a customer to your Book of Business.
